alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 7:02PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Cherokee County through 730 PM EDT... At 702 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Canton, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Canton, Holly Springs, Ball Ground, Buffington, Free Home, Hickory Flat, Union Hill, Holbrook, Lathemtown, Bridgemill and Lebanon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for north central Georgia.
